titlestmt.titleproper: Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective (HGLHC) Collection GLBTQ.2013.01

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-08T10:33-0500

did.unittitle: Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective (HGLHC) Collection
did.abstract: The Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective began as the “Hartford Gay Health Collective” in 1983 as a place for gay men to obtain screenings for STDs and Hepatitis. HIV testing was added in 1986 as a response to the HIV/AIDS crisis. In 1987, services were expanded to include women, and the name was changed to the Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective. Over the years, HGLHC has expanded to assumed responsibility for many gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender programs and services throughout the Hartford area, including the Connecticut Lesbian and Gay PRIDE festival.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective began as the “Hartford Gay Health Collective” in 1983 as a place for gay men to obtain screenings for STDs and Hepatitis. HIV testing was added in 1986 as a response to the HIV/AIDS crisis. In 1987, services were expanded to include women, and the name was changed to the Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective.

HGLHC opened its first office on Broad Street in the Community Center in 1992. In 1996 it moved to its current location at 1841 Broad Street. Over the years, HGLHC has expanded to assumed responsibility for many gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender programs and services throughout the Hartford area. LGBT youth have a place to socialize at the “Rainbow Room” within the center. Social networking sites, blogs, and email announcements have been added to HGLHC’s expanding role in the community as internet services have expanded.

As the HIV/AIDS crisis became more and more prominent, HGLHC responded with additional health programs and advocacy involvement. Some of these include taking part in the Connecticut Gay Pride Parades and sponsoring or underwriting other gay and lesbian community groups and fundraising events. From 1992 through 1994, it took responsibility for the bookeeping of the Connecticut Lesbian and Gay PRIDE Festivals, and continued to plan the festival program booklets through 1999. Presence at political functions also increased over time. Evidence of the organization’s activism includes a wealth of news releases and letters in support of LGBT issues. The collective also developed its own fundraising events, the most well known being the “One Big Event”, produced each fall, and attracting local celebrities and dignitaries. Since HGLHC has been involved in a great many collaborations with other groups within the Gay and Lesbian Community in the Hartford area, "One Big Event" is very well attended.

In addition to in-house fundraising activities, HGLHC has received funding from a variety of organizations, including the Hartford Foundation for Public Giving, the Gill Foundation, the Center of Interdisciplinary Research at Yale, and the cities of Hartford and Manchester.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes advertisements, annual reports, publicity, program flyers, correspondence, and documentation of various activities that helped to benefit the organization. The bulk of the material dates from the mid-1990’s to 2003. HGLHC's involvement with the Connecticut Lesbian and Gay PRIDE Festival is documented through planning and bookeeping files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into five series: I. Organizational Records (These also including flyers advertising programs and services) I.(a) Sponsorship of Connecticut Lesbian and Gay PRIDE Festival II. Advertising and publicity (Purchased advertisements and articles) III. Fundraising activities IV. Conferences & other activities V. Realia, and graphic materials
Several folders, donated by Linda Estabrook, with materials covering years 1990 -2004 were added in January 20014 to organizational records series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective (HGLHC) Collection (GLBTQ 2013.01), Special Collections Department, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Connecticut Gay and Lesbian PRIDE Festival (CGLPF) collection (GLBTQ.2013.02). Oral history interviews of Linda Estabrook, Albert Kissling and Robert Belliveau are available within the Digital Collections of the GLTBQ Archives on the website of Elihu Burritt Library.
